data.text:
Darren Bennett was a professional dancer on Strictly and its American version, Dancing With the Stars.

Personal Life & Career[]

Bennett was born in Sheffield, and is married to fellow former Strictly professional and choreographer, Lilia Kopylova.

Bennett first met Kopylova after his twin brother Dale, also a dancer, introduced them. In November 2005, Bennett and Kopylova won the British Championships for Professional Latin, coming first in all five dances. In November 2006, they successfully defended this title against a challenge from Olga Rodionova and Paul Richardson, who had been competing for the USA but had recently registered as a British couple. Bennett and Kopylova triumphed winning all five dances to retain the title.

In February 2008, Bennett and Kopylova were winners of the Carl Alan Award for Ballroom, Latin and Sequence (performers)- a prestigious title described by the IDTA as 'the Oscars of the world of dance'.

The couple starred in a West End dance show, Latin Fever, which they choreographed themselves, as well as choosing the music and costumes to reflect the mood of each Latin dance.

Bennett is a consultant creative producer for Dancing with the Stars Ireland, working alongside his wife and choreographer Lilia Kopylova.

Strictly Career[]

Bennett joined Strictly's professional lineup from Series 2 in Autumn 2004, and was part of the lineup until leaving the show alongside his wife, Kopylova, at the end of Series 7 in 2009.

Series 2[]

In Series 2, Bennett was partnered with EastEnders actress, Jill Halfpenny. Jill and Darren went onto win the series.

Scores[]

Final Foxtrot / "All That Jazz" 9 8 9 8 Champions Jive / "I'm Still Standing" 10 10 10 10 Showdance / "Can't Take My Eyes Off You" Dance unscored

Series 3[]

In Series 3, Bennett was partnered with television presenter Gloria Hunniford. They placed 10th.

Scores[]

Week Dance/Song Judges' Scores Result Horwood Phillips Goodman Tonioli 1 Waltz / "Lady" 4 5 7 6 Safe 2 Rumba / "Holding Back the Years" 2 4 5 6 Bottom Two 3 Jive / "Build Me Up Buttercup" 3 4 6 6 Eliminated

Series 4[]

In Series 4, Bennett was partnered with Spice Girls singer Emma Bunton. They reached the Series Semi-Final, and placed 3rd.

Scores[]

Week Dance/Song Judges' Scores Result Horwood Phillips Goodman Tonioli 1 Did not perform this week 2 Quickstep / "I Got Rhythm" 8 8 8 9 Safe 3 Jive / "Edge of Heaven" 8 8 8 9 Safe 4 Foxtrot / "One" 8 7 7 8 Safe 5 Viennese Waltz / "Kiss from a Rose" 8 9 8 9 Safe 6 Samba / "Maria" 9 9 9 9 Safe 7 Cha-Cha-Cha / "All Right Now" 7 7 9 9 Bottom Two 8 American Smooth / "Anything Goes" 8 8 9 9 Safe 9 Waltz / "The Way We Are" 9 8 10 10 Bottom Two Paso Doble / "Explosive" 9 9 9 10 10

Semi-Final Argentine Tango / "Santa Maria" 9 9 9 9 Third Place Salsa / "Ain't Nobody" 8 7 9 9

Series 5[]

In Series 5, Bennett was partnered with EastEnders actress Letitia Dean. They placed fourth.
